title: Gaelic - New Testament (Print)
description: Gaelic is an adjective that means "pertaining to the Gaels". As a noun, it refers to the group of languages spoken by the Gaels, or to any one of the languages individually. Gaelic languages are spoken in Ireland, Scotland, the Isle of Man, and Canada.

language.name: Scottish Gaelic
language.area: North and central counties of Ross, islands of Hebrides and Skye, Glasgow. Also in Australia, Canada, United States.
